left.name: Thankful
left.description: Those with higher Thankful scores thank others for their good deeds towards them or society and are grateful for whatever they have in life.

right.name: Arrogant
right.description: Those with higher Arrogant scores Either forget to say "thank you", don't care enough to express their gratitude, or feel entitled to what they are given, what they have, or more.

left.name: Welcoming
left.description: Those with higher Welcoming scores less often forget to let people know that they're welcome to seek help from them and try to make a warm and pleasing atmosphere for guests, those who are coming in on or starting something that pertains to them.

right.name: Dismissive
right.description: Those with higher Dismissive scores do not place much importance on being welcoming, making good impressions, accepting thanks, or being pleasant towards those who come to them.

left.name: Polite
left.description: Those with higher Polite scores are more likely to ask nicely when trying to get something from someone and refrain from excessively pressuring or forces others to abide by their will.

right.name: Forceful
right.description: Those with higher Forceful scores are more likely to take from others as they please, they may do things without asking, even if sometimes for what they may think is the "greater good". Or they may be forgetful of proper manners when making requests. Or they may demand things from others as opposed to letting others know that they can do something if they wish or if they have time.

left.name: Forgiving
left.description: Those with higher Progress scores believe in social change and rationality. Though not always, they are usually secular or atheist, and support environmental action and scientific or technological research.

right.name: Resentful
right.description: Those with higher Tradition scores believe in traditional values and strict adherence to a moral code. Though not always, they are usually religious, and support the status quo or the status quo ante.

left.name: Honest
left.description: Those with higher Liberty scores believe in strong civil liberties. They tend to support democracy and oppose state intervention in personal lives. Note that this refers to civil liberties, not economic liberties.

right.name: Deceitful
right.description: Those with higher Authority scores believe in strong state power. They tend to support state intervention in personal lives, government surveillance, and at high values, censorship or autocracy.

left.name: Altruistic
left.description: Those with higher Liberty scores believe in strong civil liberties. They tend to support democracy and oppose state intervention in personal lives. Note that this refers to civil liberties, not economic liberties.

right.name: Uncaring
right.description: Those with higher Authority scores believe in strong state power. They tend to support state intervention in personal lives, government surveillance, and at high values, censorship or autocracy.

left.name: Friendly

right.name: Cold
right.description: Those with higher Authority scores believe in strong state power. They tend to support state intervention in personal lives, government surveillance, and at high values, censorship or autocracy.

left.name: Confident

right.name: Turbulent
right.description: Those with higher Authority scores believe in strong state power. They tend to support state intervention in personal lives, government surveillance, and at high values, censorship or autocracy.
